title: Population
description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.

Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

origins.title: Population
origins.description:
Our World in Data builds and maintains a long-run dataset on population by country, region, and for the world, based on various sources.

You can find more information on these sources and how our time series is constructed on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
origins.citation_full: The long-run data on population is based on various sources, described on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

The data has been obtained from different sources depending on the country:

- Afghanistan: World Health Organization (https://data.who.int/dashboards/covid19/)

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

The data has been obtained from different sources depending on the country:

- Afghanistan: World Health Organization (https://data.who.int/dashboards/covid19/)

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

grapher_config.title: Number of people who received at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine
grapher_config.subtitle: Total number of people who received at least one vaccine dose.

people_fully_vaccinated.title: People fully vaccinated (cumulative)
people_fully_vaccinated.description_short: Total number of people who received all doses prescribed by the initial vaccination protocol.

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

grapher_config.title: Number of people who completed the initial COVID-19 vaccination protocol
grapher_config.subtitle: Total number of people who received all doses prescribed by the initial vaccination protocol.
grapher_config.note: Alternative definitions of a full vaccination, e.g. having been infected with SARS-CoV-2 and having 1 dose of a 2-dose protocol, are ignored to maximize comparability between countries.

daily_vaccinations.title: COVID-19 doses (daily)
daily_vaccinations.description_short: New COVID-19 vaccination doses administered (only calculated for consecutive days).

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

grapher_config.title: Daily COVID-19 vaccine doses administered
grapher_config.subtitle: All doses, including boosters, are counted individually.

people_fully_vaccinated_per_hundred.title: People fully vaccinated (cumulative, per hundred)
people_fully_vaccinated_per_hundred.description_short: Total number of people who received all doses prescribed by the initial vaccination protocol per 100 people in the total population.

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

origins.title: Population
origins.description:
Our World in Data builds and maintains a long-run dataset on population by country, region, and for the world, based on various sources.

You can find more information on these sources and how our time series is constructed on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
origins.citation_full: The long-run data on population is based on various sources, described on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources

display.name: Share of people with a complete initial protocol

grapher_config.title: Share of people who completed the initial COVID-19 vaccination protocol
grapher_config.subtitle: Total number of people who received all doses prescribed by the initial vaccination protocol, divided by the total population of the country.
grapher_config.note: Alternative definitions of a full vaccination, e.g. having been infected with SARS-CoV-2 and having 1 dose of a 2-dose protocol, are ignored to maximize comparability between countries.

people_fully_vaccinated_per_hundred.description_processing: Per-capita values have been estimated by using the population in 2022 as a reference.

total_boosters_per_hundred.title: Booster doses (cumulative, per hundred)
total_boosters_per_hundred.description_short: Total number of COVID-19 vaccination booster doses administered per 100 people in the total population.

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

The data has been obtained from different sources depending on the country:

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

origins.title: Population
origins.description:
Our World in Data builds and maintains a long-run dataset on population by country, region, and for the world, based on various sources.

You can find more information on these sources and how our time series is constructed on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
origins.citation_full: The long-run data on population is based on various sources, described on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources

grapher_config.title: COVID-19 vaccine boosters administered per 100 people
grapher_config.subtitle: Total number of vaccine booster doses administered, divided by the total population of the country. Booster doses are doses administered beyond those prescribed by the original vaccination protocol.

total_boosters_per_hundred.description_processing: Per-capita values have been estimated by using the population in 2022 as a reference.

daily_people_vaccinated_smoothed_per_hun.title: People vaccinated (daily, 7-day average, per million people)
daily_people_vaccinated_smoothed_per_hun.description_short: Daily number of people receiving their first vaccine dose (7-day smoothed) per 100 people in the total population.

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

The data has been obtained from different sources depending on the country:

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

origins.title: Population
origins.description:
Our World in Data builds and maintains a long-run dataset on population by country, region, and for the world, based on various sources.

You can find more information on these sources and how our time series is constructed on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
origins.citation_full: The long-run data on population is based on various sources, described on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources

grapher_config.title: Daily share of the population receiving a first COVID-19 vaccine dose
grapher_config.subtitle: 7-day rolling average

daily_people_vaccinated_smoothed_per_hun.description_processing: Per-capita values have been estimated by using the population in 2022 as a reference.

daily_vaccinations_smoothed_per_million.title: COVID-19 doses (daily, 7-day average, per million people)
daily_vaccinations_smoothed_per_million.description_short: New COVID-19 vaccination doses administered (7-day smoothed) per 1,000,000 people in the total population

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

origins.title: Population
origins.description:
Our World in Data builds and maintains a long-run dataset on population by country, region, and for the world, based on various sources.

You can find more information on these sources and how our time series is constructed on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
origins.citation_full: The long-run data on population is based on various sources, described on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources

grapher_config.title: Daily COVID-19 vaccine doses administered per million people
grapher_config.subtitle: 7-day rolling average. All doses, including boosters, are counted individually.

daily_vaccinations_smoothed_per_million.description_processing: Per-capita values have been estimated by using the population in 2022 as a reference.

people_unvaccinated.title: Unvaccinated people (cumulative)
people_unvaccinated.description_short: Total number of people who have not received any vaccine dose.

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

The data has been obtained from different sources depending on the country:

- Afghanistan: World Health Organization (https://data.who.int/dashboards/covid19/)

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

people_unvaccinated.description_processing: This indicator is derived from the country population in a given day. Daily population estimates are obtained by linearly interpolating the year-estimtes by UN WPP.

share_of_boosters.title: Share of daily COVID-19 doses that are boosters
share_of_boosters.description_short: 14-day rolling average. Booster doses are doses administered beyond those prescribed by the original vaccination protocol.

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

total_vaccinations_interpolated.title: COVID-19 doses (cumulative, interpolated)
total_vaccinations_interpolated.description_short: Total number of COVID-19 vaccination doses administered. Linearly interpolated values.

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

people_vaccinated_interpolated.title: People vaccinated (cumulative, interpolated)
people_vaccinated_interpolated.description_short: Total number of people who received at least one vaccine dose. Linearly interpolated values.

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

The data has been obtained from different sources depending on the country:

- Afghanistan: World Health Organization (https://data.who.int/dashboards/covid19/)

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

total_vaccinations_no_boosters_interpola.title: Initial doses (cumulative, interpolated)
total_vaccinations_no_boosters_interpola.description_short: Total number of inital doses. Total number of COVID-19 vaccination intial doses administered (doses administered as prescribed by the initial vaccination protocol).

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

total_vaccinations_no_boosters_per_hundr.title: Initial doses (cumulative, interpolated, per hundred)
total_vaccinations_no_boosters_per_hundr.description_short: Total number of inital doses. Total number of COVID-19 vaccination intial doses administered (doses administered as prescribed by the initial vaccination protocol).

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

origins.title: Population
origins.description:
Our World in Data builds and maintains a long-run dataset on population by country, region, and for the world, based on various sources.

You can find more information on these sources and how our time series is constructed on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
origins.citation_full: The long-run data on population is based on various sources, described on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources

rolling_vaccinations_6m_per_hundred.title: COVID-19 doses (last 6 months, per hundred)
rolling_vaccinations_6m_per_hundred.description_short: Total number of COVID-19 vaccination doses administered in the last 6 months, per hundred people.

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

origins.title: Population
origins.description:
Our World in Data builds and maintains a long-run dataset on population by country, region, and for the world, based on various sources.

You can find more information on these sources and how our time series is constructed on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
origins.citation_full: The long-run data on population is based on various sources, described on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources

grapher_config.title: How many COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered in the previous 6 months?
grapher_config.subtitle: Per 100 people in the population. The value shown for each date is the total number of vaccine doses administered in the 6 months preceding that date. All doses, including boosters, are counted individually.

rolling_vaccinations_6m_per_hundred.description_processing: Per-capita values have been estimated by using the population in 2022 as a reference.

rolling_vaccinations_9m_per_hundred.title: COVID-19 doses (last 9 months, per hundred)
rolling_vaccinations_9m_per_hundred.description_short: Total number of COVID-19 vaccination doses administered in the last 9 months, per hundred people.

origins.producer: Official data collated by Our World in Data
origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations
origins.description:
Country-by-country data on global COVID-19 vaccinations. We only rely on figures that are verifiable based on public official sources.

This dataset includes some subnational locations (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Northern Cyprus…) and international aggregates (World, continents, European Union…).

The data produced by third parties and made available by Our World in Data is subject to the license terms from the original third-party authors. We will always indicate the original source of the data in our database, and you should always check the license of any such third-party data before use.
origins.citation_full:
Mathieu, E., Ritchie, H., Ortiz-Ospina, E. et al. A global database of COVID-19 vaccinations. Nat Hum Behav (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01122-8

origins.title: COVID-19, vaccinations (WHO)
origins.description: COVID-19 vaccination data are collected via WHO regional office-specific systems for monitoring COVID-19 vaccination uptake.  These data are pooled from numerous sources, including direct reports from Member States, WHO review of publicly available official data, or data collated and published by third-party sites. Data published by third-party sites have not been validated by WHO, and WHO cannot comment on accuracy or completeness. Differences in counts may occur compared to other sources, due to different inclusion criteria and data cut-off times.
origins.citation_full: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard. Geneva: World Health Organization, 2020. Available online: https://covid19.who.int/

origins.title: Population
origins.description:
Our World in Data builds and maintains a long-run dataset on population by country, region, and for the world, based on various sources.

You can find more information on these sources and how our time series is constructed on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
origins.citation_full: The long-run data on population is based on various sources, described on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources

grapher_config.title: How many COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered in the previous 9 months?
grapher_config.subtitle: Per 100 people in the population. The value shown for each date is the total number of vaccine doses administered in the 9 months preceding that date. All doses, including boosters, are counted individually.

rolling_vaccinations_9m_per_hundred.description_processing: Per-capita values have been estimated by using the population in 2022 as a reference.
